class defi_sdk_py.helper_future_trade.EntryPrice(entry_price: int, swap_fee: int, swap_size: int)[source]

Bases: object

Represents the entry price details of a position.

Parameters:

  • entry_price – The entry price of the position

  • swap_fee – The swap fee incurred

  • swap_size – The size of the swap

class defi_sdk_py.helper_future_trade.GetBalanceDetails(free_balance: int, used_balance: int, total_balance: int)[source]

Bases: object

Represents the balance details of an account.

Parameters:

  • free_balance – The free balance that is not used as margin

  • used_balance – The balance used as margin

  • total_balance – The total balance of the account

class defi_sdk_py.helper_future_trade.HelperFutureTrade[source]

Bases: object

HelperFutureTrade provides utility functions to assist with future trade calculations.

get_all_active_positions(nft_id: int) → List[PositionData][source]

Retrieves all active positions for a given NFT ID.

Parameters:

nft_id – The NFT ID associated with the positions

Returns:

A list of PositionData objects representing all active positions

get_average_price(nft_id: int, pair_byte: str, is_long: bool, contract_size: int, expected_rate: int, slip_page: int) → int[source]

Calculates the average entry price for a position after considering the expected rate and slippage.

Parameters:

  • nft_id – The NFT ID associated with the position

  • pair_byte – The byte representation of the pair associated with the position

  • is_long – A boolean indicating if the position is long (True) or short (False)

  • contract_size – The size of the contract

  • expected_rate – The expected rate for the position

  • slip_page – The slippage percentage

Returns:

The average entry price

get_balance_after_open_position(nft_id: int, pair_byte: str, is_long: bool, contract_size: int, expected_rate: int, slip_page: int) → int[source]

Calculates the account balance after opening a new position.

Parameters:

  • nft_id – The NFT ID associated with the position

  • pair_byte – The byte representation of the pair associated with the position

  • is_long – A boolean indicating if the position is long (True) or short (False)

  • contract_size – The size of the contract

  • expected_rate – The expected rate for the position

  • slip_page – The slippage percentage

Returns:

The account balance after opening the position

get_balance_details(nft_id: int, pair_byte: str) → GetBalanceDetails[source]

Retrieves the balance details for a given NFT ID and pair.

Parameters:

  • nft_id – The NFT ID associated with the position

  • pair_byte – The byte representation of the pair associated with the position

Returns:

get_closing_fee(nft_id: int, pair_byte: str, contract_size: int) → OpeningClosingFee[source]

Calculates the closing fee for terminating an existing position.

Parameters:

  • nft_id – The NFT ID associated with the position

  • pair_byte – The byte representation of the pair associated with the position

  • contract_size – The size of the contract being closed

Returns:

An OpeningClosingFee object containing the swap fee, trading fee, and total fee for closing the position

get_entry_price(nft_id: int, pair_byte: str, is_long: bool, contract_size: int, expected_rate: int, slip_page: int) → EntryPrice[source]

Calculates the entry price for a new position.

Parameters:

  • nft_id – The NFT ID associated with the position

  • pair_byte – The byte representation of the pair associated with the position

  • is_long – A boolean indicating if the position is long (True) or short (False)

  • contract_size – The size of the contract

  • expected_rate – The expected rate for the position

  • slip_page – The slippage percentage

Returns:

An EntryPrice object containing the entry price, swap fee, and swap size

Parameters:

  • nft_id – The NFT ID associated with the position

  • pair_byte – The byte representation of the pair associated with the position

  • is_long – A boolean indicating if the position is long (True) or short (False)

  • contract_size – The size of the contract

  • expected_rate – The expected rate for the position

  • slip_page – The slippage percentage

Returns:

The liquidation price immediately after opening the position

get_margin_after_adjust_collateral(nft_id: int, pair_byte: str, is_add: bool, amount: int) → int[source]

Calculates the margin after adjusting the collateral for a given position.

Parameters:

  • nft_id – The NFT ID associated with the position

  • pair_byte – The byte representation of the pair associated with the position

  • is_add – A boolean indicating if collateral is being added (True) or removed (False)

  • amount – The amount of collateral to adjust

Returns:

The margin after collateral adjustment

  • pair_byte – The byte representation of the pair associated with the position

  • contract_size – The size of the contract being closed

get_margin_after_open_position(nft_id: int, pair_byte: str, is_long: bool, contract_size: int, expected_rate: int, slip_page: int) → int[source]

Calculates the margin requirement after opening a new position.

Parameters:

  • nft_id – The NFT ID associated with the position

  • pair_byte – The byte representation of the pair associated with the position

  • is_long – A boolean indicating if the position is long (True) or short (False)

  • contract_size – The size of the contract

  • expected_rate – The expected rate for the position

  • slip_page – The slippage percentage

Returns:

The margin requirement after the position has been opened

get_max_contract_size(nft_id: int, pair_byte: str, is_long: bool, leverage: int, expected_rate: int, slip_page: int) → int[source]

Calculates the maximum contract size that can be opened based on the available margin and leverage.

Parameters:

  • nft_id – The NFT ID associated with the position

  • pair_byte – The byte representation of the pair associated with the position

  • is_long – A boolean indicating if the position is long (True) or short (False)

  • leverage – The leverage being used for the position

  • expected_rate – The expected rate for the position

  • slip_page – The slippage percentage

Returns:

The maximum contract size that can be opened

Parameters:

  • nft_id – The NFT ID associated with the position

  • pair_byte – The byte representation of the pair associated with the position

Returns:

The maximum withdrawal amount

get_opening_fee(nft_id: int, pair_byte: str, is_long: bool, contract_size: int, expected_rate: int, slip_page: int) → OpeningClosingFee[source]

Calculates the opening fee for initiating a new position.

Parameters:

  • nft_id – The NFT ID associated with the position

  • pair_byte – The byte representation of the pair associated with the position

  • is_long – A boolean indicating if the position is long (True) or short (False)

  • contract_size – The size of the contract

  • expected_rate – The expected rate for the position

  • slip_page – The slippage percentage

Returns:

An OpeningClosingFee object containing the swap fee, trading fee, and total fee for opening the position

get_pnl_after_close_position(nft_id: int, pair_byte: str, contract_size: int) → UnrealizedPNL[source]

Calculates the profit or loss (PNL) after closing a position.

Parameters:

  • nft_id – The NFT ID associated with the position

  • pair_byte – The byte representation of the pair associated with the position

  • contract_size – The size of the contract being closed

Returns:

An UnrealizedPNL object containing the PNL and ROE after closing the position

  • pair_byte – The byte representation of the pair associated with the position

get_position_states(nft_id: int, cursor: int = 1, result_per_page: int = 1) → GetPositionStates[source]

Retrieves the states of positions for a given NFT ID, along with pagination information.

Parameters:

  • nft_id – The NFT ID associated with the positions

  • cursor – The cursor position for pagination

  • result_per_page – The number of results per page

Returns:

A GetPositionStates object containing a list of position states and the next cursor position

get_required_collateral(nft_id: int, pair_byte: str, is_long: bool, contract_size: int, leverage: int, expected_rate: int, slip_page: int) → int[source]

Calculates the required collateral for opening a position with specified leverage.

Parameters:

  • nft_id – The NFT ID associated with the position

  • pair_byte – The byte representation of the pair associated with the position

  • is_long – A boolean indicating if the position is long (True) or short (False)

  • contract_size – The size of the contract

  • leverage – The leverage being used for the position

  • expected_rate – The expected rate for the position

  • slip_page – The slippage percentage

Returns:

The required collateral amount

get_unrealized_pnl(nft_id: int, pair_byte: str) → UnrealizedPNL[source]

Retrieves the unrealized profit or loss (PNL) and return on equity (ROE) for a given position.

Parameters:

  • nft_id – The NFT ID associated with the position

  • pair_byte – The byte representation of the pair associated with the position

Returns:

An UnrealizedPNL object containing the PNL and ROE

class defi_sdk_py.helper_future_trade.OpeningClosingFee(swap_fee: int, trading_fee: int, total_fee: int)[source]

Bases: object

Represents the fees associated with opening or closing a position.

Parameters:

  • swap_fee – The fee for swapping

  • trading_fee – The fee for trading

  • total_fee – The total fee incurred

  • roe – The return on equity
